name: C2c-distance
tagline: Calculates the distance from one character on the keyboard to another character found in a "match" eg. when searching for something.
body:
### About C2C
It measures distance between keys on the keyboard.

### How it's supposed to work.
![Crudely drawn image depicting a keyboard with QWERTY-layout.](http://i.imgur.com/5ClopuS.png?1)
The idea is that a user inputs a word, if that word is misspelled when compared to say a keyword that you have stored somewhere, you get a number representing the distance that the input word has from the keyword.

Example: 
User enters Damp
'Damp' is matched to words that you have somewhere, in this case we can say that you keep a DB full of swearwords.
The word 'Damn' exists in your DB. The distance between 'Damp' -> 'Damn' is 4.47 UNOD(units of distance)
It is then up to you to set some sort of threshold for when a word "close enough" to be a match.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
